messages.author: Wez
messages.text: nit: Add a comment before these two methods to explain their purpose.

messages.author: Wez
messages.text: Is the XFlush needed here in case we're about to tear-down the Display, and thereby lose any un-flushed data? If so then I'd suggest doing it after clipboard_->Stop(), so it'll apply to any X calls performed during Core::Stop().

messages.author: Lambros
messages.text:

> nit: GetAutoRepeatMode -> IsAutoRepeatEnabled()

Done.

messages.author: Lambros
messages.text:
On 2013/03/11 16:22:04, Wez wrote:
> nit: auto_repeat_enabled_
I've kept "saved" in the name, because otherwise your suggestions would cause this name to match the new Is/Set.. methods, making them look like getters/setters for this variable, when they're not.

messages.author: Lambros
messages.text:
On 2013/03/11 16:22:04, Wez wrote:
> Is the XFlush needed here in case we're about to tear-down the Display, and
> thereby lose any un-flushed data? If so then I'd suggest doing it after
> clipboard_->Stop(), so it'll apply to any X calls performed during Core::Stop().
Removed this block of code.
